history.content:
1) As it stands there are 23 seats open so there's a good chance you won't be forcefully dropped.

2) Since the course is very condensed, you'll be missing four lectures, two discussions, and two labs. The first week is where we teach all the content in the course revolving around C (pointers, memory layout, etc) and it is necessary knowledge for project 1. If you are extremely dedicated to learning the material, then you might not fall too behind. However you should email your TA and ask what they can do about checking off your labs and missing their discussion.

children.subject: Rebecca Herman and I are the summer instructors and we haven't picked a head TA yet, but I can let you know when we do pick. Our emails are on the current 61c staff page: http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs61c/sp17/staff.php

I just emailed you and Rebecca to explain my situation further.

Thanks!
I actually haven't enrolled yet. Do you know who would be good to email? Perhaps the head TA in charge of the course this summer if you happen to know how that is?

history.content:
Hi,

I would like to take CS61C over the summer, but I will need to miss the first week of instruction. Few questions.

1) Is this allowed? Or will I be dropped from the course? I will need to miss the first week due to attending competition for a student engineering team I'm a part of at Berkeley.

2) Will I fall severely behind if I miss the first week of 61C over summer? I'm planning on learning the material before the first day of instruction after spring semester ends, so how important will the first week be?

Thanks!
history.subject: Taking CS61C Over the Summer But Will Need to Miss the First Week of Class
